column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Test a Business Continuity Plan
#Text=A plan is as good as its implementation .
#Text=If we do not execute the plan , the very purpose of the plan is defeated .
#Text=In case of a business continuity plan , there is a twist in the tale .
#Text=This is because a Business Continuity Plan comes into use only when a situation calls for it .
#Text=Otherwise , it remains a plan .
#Text=So , it is important to test the plan at regular intervals to make sure that it serves the purpose .
#Text=The testing is also an indication of the emergency preparedness .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Study the plan thoroughly and ensure that it is updated .
#Text=In case you want the testing to reveal the gaps , then you may skip the above step .
#Text=However , in order to get the most out of the testing exercise , it is always better to ensure that the plan is updated .
#Text=For instance , telephone numbers might have undergone a change or there could be people movements .
#Text=Having updated the plan , the next step is to plan the testing itself .

#Text=Write out the clear objective of the testing plan along with details about who all are required to be part of the testing exercise , what is their role , type of testing exercise that you are envisaging , what are the expected outcomes .

#Text=Having done the above , decide if you want to opt for a desktop exercise ( where you simulate a real life scenario in a meeting hall or a conference room ) or you would like to do it on a real time basis .
#Text=For the testing exercise , it is also crucial to inform all the stakeholders well in advance so that they are prepared .
#Text=Keep the top management team informed so that employees take the testing plan with all the seriousness that it deserves .
#Text=Communicate the venue in advance along with the date and ensure that there are no last minute cancellations .
#Text=Testing a Business Continuity Plan is serious business that ca n't be delegated lower down the line .
#Text=Be mentally prepared for the challenges - indifferent responses , last minute cancellations etc and focus on the broader goals .

#Text=It is advisable to have one or two sponsors for this exercise - like the Marketing director or Operations director or HR director who can add value and positional influence to the testing exercise .
#Text=Generally the duration of the testing exercise depends on a number of factors but in general , you can have a 1-day session for a desktop testing exercise .
#Text=It is advisable to have the testing exercise off-site but often due to cost factors and logistical constraints , the testing is done at the relevant location .
#Text=3-days prior to the testing date , send an executive summary of the testing plan to all stake holders .
#Text=Have the case studies ready at hand that describe the sequence of hazardous events taking place .
#Text=On the scheduled date , begin the testing by clarifying the objectives clearly in the opening session .
#Text=Explain to the audience that this is neither a fact finding mission or a fault finding mission but an attempt to ensure that the business continuity plan is fit for purpose .
#Text=Have one resource dedicated for capturing the data on a spread sheet live when the testing is in progress .
#Text=Let there be one more resource who documents the proceedings in minute details .
#Text=( this is not a stenographer/typist 's job as most people seem to believe ) .
#Text=Please note that documentation is not only important but also all minor details need to be documented .
#Text=Following the completion of the testing plan , it is important to give a break and request all to reassemble after 30 minutes .
#Text=During this period , capture the key lessons from the exercise .
#Text=Seek feedback from audience to add value to the document .
#Text=You can ask open ended questions like - What went wrong , what went well etc and use the answers to enrich the document .
#Text=Do not run down any feedback .
#Text=In the closing session , thank the people for spending their time .
#Text=Insist on a top management team member address the group and share their thoughts and provide assurance that the feedback will be used to rebuild the plan more effectively .
#Text=Post testing , communicate the gaps to the group via Email and also inform them about how these gaps have been used to update the plan .
#Text=Update the plan , archive the earlier versions and communicate the new plan to all stakeholders with the revision number and date .
#Text=Do seek management feedback ( You ask and you will get it ! )
#Text=It may be worthwhile to do a random check on the next period for testing the plan ( perhaps after 6 months ) and also if we can do a real time simulation .
#Text=For example allow operations at a site to come to a grinding halt by way of artificially created hazard and then work at testing the plan .
#Text=This will need buy-in from the top team .
